Description: Ostracon, fragment (three pieces joined) of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a brown resinous substance and caked with organic matter, the exterior is covered with a red-brown coloured slip and bears the remains of two columns with ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a table of fractions.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.56)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.270)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (89512) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/89512)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 327 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 26 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
